pageContext.claim: “And they're doing it. They're doing it. You saw South Korea, they were paying us $500 million a year. I say you got to do more. You got to give more. Anyway. Now they're up to almost $900 million, that was like two phone calls.”
pageContext.analysis: This is wrong. The State Department said South Korea paid $830 billion in 2018. The new agreement for $924 million amounts to a 8.2 percent increase over a previous five-year agreement.
